prs.title: Merge dev into main for v1.0.0
prs.truncated_body:
Stable release cut for btc-staking-ts lib.
Trunk release has not been applied on this repo. so we will continue with the existing approach. Future releases might change to trunk based

prs.title: hotfix: Support two rand genrator for backward-compatibility
prs.truncated_body:
## Goal

For people who are running with old randomness generation scheme to commit with the new scheme so that they can switch to released version automatically after the old rand ran out.

## Approach

1. Fix will be implemented on the `hotfix` branch https://github.com/babylonlabs-io/finality-provider/tree/delete-sign-record-hotfix
2. Bump babylon dependency to rc.8
3. Implement 2 versi

prs.title: Fix type inference issues caused by deranged crate update
prs.truncated_body:
The deranged `deranged` crate update has caused havoc in a lot of random crates due to overlapping `PartialOrd` trait implementations.

See https://github.com/jhpratt/deranged/issues/18 and https://github.com/jhpratt/deranged/issues/19.

Currently uses a fix from the https://github.com/fortanix/rust-sgx/pull/726 branch which should be changed to a released version once it becomes available.

commits.message: Fix type inference issues caused by deranged crate update

prs.title: go/consensus: Clean light client interfaces
prs.truncated_body:
I think our light client service implementation is not very useful and that the whole service can be removed:
- The CometBFT light client is never used.
- The trust store is never pruned.
- The trust store contains only a few valid light blocks (one per epoch, not older than trust period).
  - This causes issues for the CometBFT light client, as it will give up if the primary provider cannot f

commits.message:
go/consensus/cometbft/light/service: Prune trust store

The trust store was never pruned because the CometBFT client
was never utilized.

go/consensus/cometbft/light/service: Remove unused cometbft light client

Since the CometBFT client was never used, we can retrieve light blocks
directly from providers.
go/consensus/cometbft/light/p2p: Remove chain ID from provider pool

go/consensus/cometbft/light/service: Remove sparse light block store

If the CometBFT light client fails to find a light block at a specific
height, it will not attempt to fetch a neighboring one. Since the service
stores only one block per epoch, the likelihood of the light client
requesting that exact height is very low. This makes the trust store
from the service ineffective, especially considering that blocks are
no longer trusted once the trust period expires.

prs.title: chore: allow individuals to extend `direnv` config
prs.truncated_body:
## Why this should be merged

We use a project-wide `.envrc` to configure reproducible builds but each developer may wish to further customise their development environment.

## How this works

If a `.envrc.local` file is present, it is loaded at the end of the common `.envrc`. This file is in `.gitignore`.

## How this was tested

## Need to be documented in RELEASES.md?

No

commits.message: chore: allow individuals to extend `direnv` config
